result.execSummary:
The defendant Deareal T. Lott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 91 days, if revoked.
Reveiw Hrg on 3/31/15 @ 8:30am.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Damon Early, Tenisha Gaston or known felons, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Review hrg on 3/31/15 @ 8:30am P&P to provide written report.  Attend school every day on time and show proof to agent.  Any relationships w/ women to be approved by agent.

supervisions.notes:
Probation Revoked.
Any unpaid court obligations are still to be collected.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Tenisha G, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: Court reporter transcript invoice for sentencing 4/06/16 paid by county $36.00.
4/6/16 - Sentencing Hearing
Presentence incarceration credit.
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Celebre.  Clerk/H. Barnett.   Court imposes a total sentence of 4 1/2 years WSP; 3 years initial confinement w/credit for 228 days served, 18 months extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP/SAP.  Deft was given notice of appeal and is refusing to sign it; appeal starts running today.
With Atty Celebre the SEHR of 4/5/16 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, as he has a conflict w/a Br 7 case; reset to 4/6/16 at 1:15pm.
Revocation packet.

Screen 77 (CACU-I77C) w/copy of Revocation Order and Warrant; filed by Dept of Corr/Probation&Parole.   Defendant revoked on ; to be returned to court for sentencing.  ZERO PAID ON PROBATION - ALL COSTS STILL DUE.
At the request of DOC Agt Michael McConville and with Atty Celebre a SEHR is set for 4/5/16 at 1:15pm.
Atty David Celebre
Atty Kristyne Watson
Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Probation review.  No action taken.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions; 1 year conditional jail is stayed; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; credit for 91 days served if revoked.  RH 3/31/15 at 8:30am.
deft released from custody as to this file only.
Modified bond signed.
*No Contact w/Tenisha G or her residence.  Live at Grandmother's house at 4018 28th Ave #7.  No drugs.  No alcohol.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2 thru 6 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  SEH 11/25/14 at 9:30am.  Court amends bond to a $1,500 signature bond w/conditions.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Perz states his investigator needs more time.  FPT continued to 9/25/14 at 3pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Perz acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  FPT 9/3/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Matt Perz. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 7-21-14 @ 8:15am with 14CM543. Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing
Matt Perz

221 p.m.  Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Bennett.  Clk:  LE  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Comm Mason on  7/8/14 @ 1015 A.M.  $1500 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*No Contact w/Tenisha G or her residence
